reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: F.a: Livelihood support in Myanmar border areas

description.narrative: For decades Myanmar, and especially its border areas, have been isolated from international and regional development. After changes in political environment and opening after international isolation, Myanmar has the potential for economic growth given its rich natural resources, young workforce and access to markets of significant neighbouring economies. One of the biggest challenges for Myanmar economy is lack of skilled labour. At the same time, according to Census data (2014) Myanmar has high youth popul ation that is potential workforce in coming years, but only about 0.04 percent of the population had access to Technical and Vocational Education and Training (TVET). On the other hand, the government technical schools have limited capacity to provide qual ified education that would meet demands of the job market. The project seeks to contribute to peace building un Myanmar border areas through increasing access to quality vocational education and consequently increase opportunities and self-reliance for you th and other vulnerable IDP's returnees' and hosting community members. The specific objective is that the targeted youth and other vulnerable groups are equipped with technical and life skills to enhance their potentials for livelihood and life management . The project is implemented in cooperation with Government Technical High School which will implement 3 batches of 4 vocational education short courses annually. In addition elected local CBOs facilitate each 2 vocational education courses. At the same ti me project focuses in development of vocational education in targeted communities and working area in three priority areas: accessibility, quality of trainings and improved connection of VE and providers to private sector.
